Articles.Content:
I built a Mun lander a few days ago and noticed that 909's seem to be giving me a lot more delta-v than the Nerv nuclear engines - 3999 m/s on the 909's compared to only 2176 m/s on the LV-N (from Mechjeb Delta-V Stats). So I checked the values with an online dV calculator (http://www.strout.net/info/science/delta-v/) using the masses and ISPs listed below:

Mun lander, 4 x LV-N "Nerv" engines:

Full mass: 45400 kg

Dry mass: 35400 kg

Engine ISP: 800 s

Delta-V: 5900 m/s

Mun lander, 4 x LV-909 "Terrier" engines:

Full mass: 35400 kg

Dry mass: 11400 kg

Engine ISP: 345 s

Delta-V: 3833 m/s

Now, as you can see, the LV-N is clearly WAY underpowered in terms of efficiency since it achieves less than half of the delta-V it should. Or is it just Mechjeb being dumb and unable to calculate dV properly?

Discuss.
You're probably carrying oxidizer? New nerva is liquid fuel only.
Yeah, you're probably carrying around oxidizer you don't need. THe LV-N only uses Liquid Fuel now, like a real live NERVA would.

You're probably carrying oxidizer? New nerva is liquid fuel only.
Yeah, you're probably carrying around oxidizer you don't need. THe LV-N only uses Liquid Fuel now, like a real live NERVA would.

Removing oxidizer improved the situation a bit, however, it still only has 3306 m/s of delta-V compared to the 5900 m/s it should have. There is definitely something weird going on.

E: Can someone else test this too and post results?

- - - Updated - - -

Derp, I think I *might* be stupid. I ran the calculations again with no oxidizer mass included and it said the dV is a bit over 3200. I guess that's because the empty weight with 909's is only about half of what it is with the LV-N's. So apparently it isn't the go-to engine for almost everything anymore. In fact, it seems to be completely useless for anything under 60 or 70 tons. I tried the same thing on my asteroid tug (~55 tons) and I get nearly 30% more dV with the LV-909's.

Edited April 30, 2015 by CaptainKorhonen

We need more LF only tanks now... currently, they are only available for spaceplane parts...

As much as its cool to cruise around in a spaceplane looking thing.... I'd prefer if the spaceplane parts were left in LKO, and I instead released pure spacecraft from my cargo spaceplanes.

The other nerf to the LV-N is that its TWR is only 75% of what it used to be... so the dry mass is even higher
